message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CE, cs.CR, cs.SI

Reasoning: The paper discusses a definition of causality using structural equations, which is a common approach in artificial intelligence and machine learning (cs.AI, cs.LG). The extension of the definition to capture degrees of responsibility and blame involves probabilistic reasoning, which is also relevant to computational ethics and decision-making (cs.CE, cs.CR). The paper also touches on issues of typicality and epistemic states, which are relevant to the field of social informatics (cs.SI).
